“Kainzo! Barrier back up, now!” You hear Nel shout, and see his form silhouetted in the purple light overhead as he leaps toward Kjorikos from behind. The Artificer turns, appearing briefly nonplussed, as Nel lands feet first on his chest, grabbing him by the head. There's a distinct pause before Kjorikos grabs him, throwing him aside in a dusting of indigo flames with a single gauntleted hand.

Kainzo raises his barrier, shielding the two of you in time for an enormous explosion of force and wild, coiling energy to erupt from the Artificer's direction—you hear Kjorikos grunt, in what sounds like pain, and see his silhouette levitate deeper into the woods, chased away by more caster fire from outside the clearing.

“Huh.” Kainzo says, dusting himself off as the barrier dissipates. “Kid planted one of Ayla's bombs.”

> [[ HP: 23 / 35 ]]

Nel and Tatsumaki join you, looking pretty badly beaten up already. You see the others pulling themselves over the downed trees to meet up with you in the clearing. Eunoia leaves your shoulder to reunite with Aelriss.

“Damnit, he's too quick.” Donnel pants.

“We've got to go after him.” Andor replies.

“No deal. I was ahead of you guys for a while.” Nel says. “He's leading us toward a cliff. This place empties into a proper abyss.”

“So, what do we do?” Aelriss says. “I mean, if we corner him, we'll actually be able to attack him all at once.”

“But he's got no problem attacking all of us at once.” Kainzo says, then examines a faintly-glowing bracer around his left wrist. “Bastion is down for five minutes this time. I think we're gonna have to find a way to lure him into another clearing. Somewhere we've got cover.”

“Uh huh.” Vyx says. “You have any ideas as to how we're going to lure him out? He practically controls the weather in here.”

"Certainly doesn't seem like time is an issue for his type." Dorian adds. "I imagine he'd be perfectly content with our deliberation no matter the outcome."

"So, what, then?" Donnel asks.

“We could smash the place up,” Aelriss says. “He cares about this world, right? Maybe if we destroy it, he'll come to us.”

“I doubt it. Looks like he's already done more damage than any of us would be capable of.” You shrug. “I don't think he cares. He probably just wants to die.”

“His AI seems... really good.” Ayla says.

“Tell me about it,” You respond. You were holding a conversation with him. “Think someone's controlling him?”

“Maybe?” Ayla asks. “Would they really have people just sitting down in every dungeon?”

“Let's not dwell on it,” Kainzo suggests. “Whatever we decide, I'd rather he not have more time to prepare.”

[[ 1 ]]
> Use a lesser healing potion now (2 left).
> Wait for an emergency.

[[ 2 ]]
> Chase him to the cliff.
> Try to lure him into the woods.
> Write-in.

> [[ 64 ]]
> [[ 2 – Reduced Effect ]]

“Don't follow him all the way out of cover!” You charge forward, and at your back, translucent wings unfold. The hoofbeats of a cavalcade of unseen horses herald your coming. There's a clearing ahead, where you can lie in ambush. But first, you've got to make it...

“I don't think he's buying it!” You hear a distant shout from Nel. Lightning erupts from the darkness, burning the forest canopy and taking cuttings from the trees overhead. It narrowly misses you; the projectile is far too quick for you to avoid, but you can feel the buildup of energy in the air, and approximate its direction beforehand.

You end up hitting the ground hard to avoid a falling tree limb, charge coming to an abrupt halt; turning your head to the side in the dirt, you see Vyx stumble and fall into the brush, body crackling with purple energy. Aelriss and Eunoia stop at her side, while the other members of the raid maneuver around you, making their way ahead.

Damn, he's a good shot. You suppose you were expecting someone a bit more scholarly.

There's a shape—an unfamiliar shadow, rising out from behind the brush near Aelriss and Vyx.

> Charge the newcomer before it can attack.
> Warn them, then get up and look for Kjorikos.
> Write-in.

But you waste no time, leaping onto your feet as quickly as you can. Sword prepared in both hands, you shout as you charge toward the attacker, unwilling to allow the sound of distant chariots to end for more than a moment.

It comes into view, as you leap over Aelriss and the downed Vyx—a strange, twisted-looking construct of porcelain, earth, and crackling crystals—an enormous, upside-down teardrop with oversized arms and legs.

Hopefully you won't fuck this one up too.

“We're taking that thing down.” You point into the woods, where it chased off Eunoia. In the distance, you can see them start to circle back your way.

“Alright.” Aelriss nods. “Vyx, give us some supporting fire while you're on your way to meet back up with the group, if you can.”

“What?” Vyx asks. "You're kidding."

“As it is, they're barely able to touch Kjorikos. You're the best ranged damage we've got, and they'll need it up there.” Aelriss continues.

“I feel like I could say the same for your support.” Vyx says, folding her arms. "Your bird can heal people, can't it?"

“Thing is, Ashe and I are kind of cursed. I'm still not sure what that entails, but it seems reasonable that there's a potential for you to get dragged into it...” Aelriss says.

“Well, fuck that, then.” Vyx says, checking her weapons before she waves you off. “Good luck.”

“You sure about this, Ael?” You ask.

“Yeah,” She lolls her neck in a circle. “We got this.”

“Watch those crystals. Seems like they pop on contact.” You suggest.

“I'll have Eunoia shoot 'em down.” Aelriss responds.

The construct is stomping through the brush towards you, chasing Aelriss's happily fluttering bird of paradise.

> Take him down at the kneecaps.
> Pierce the torso with Concussive Strike in hopes of hitting a core.
> Jump and try to strike the arms.
> Write-in.

“You ready?” You ask.

“As I'll ever be.” Aelriss readies her staff. “Wait for Eunoia to turn.”

You're not an actual cavalier; you don't even have enough room for the effect of your mail to kick in. But this'll probably do just fine. It's not ready at all when your bastard sword finds a mark, buried three-quarters to the hilt in its upper body. The concussive force doesn't knock the construct back quite yet, though; it reverberates within, spreading out, and you see wavering air and dust burst forth from all of the cracks in its form.

An explosion of raw force sends large ceramic fragments in all directions, and opens a tremendous cavity within the creature's body, revealing a brilliant crystal core which you've thoroughly impaled. You let yourself fall to the ground now, as the monster stumbles backwards, swinging wildly.

You and Aelriss nod at one another. Then, you each take a leg, simultaneously swinging your weapons to shatter the armor and knock the construct to the ground, where the light within dies.

“Hang on,” You say, as a familiar light catches your attention. You raise an eyebrow; Ael is turning a bit red. “Let's see if we've got anything.”

You're not an actual cavalier; you don't even have enough room for the effect of your mail to kick in. But this'll probably do just fine. It's not ready at all when your bastard sword finds a mark, buried three-quarters to the hilt in its upper body. The concussive force doesn't knock the construct back quite yet, though; it reverberates within, spreading out, and you see wavering air and dust burst forth from all of the cracks in its form.

An explosion of raw force sends large ceramic fragments in all directions, and opens a tremendous cavity within the creature's body, revealing a brilliant crystal core which you've thoroughly impaled. You let yourself fall to the ground now, as the monster stumbles backwards, swinging wildly.

You and Aelriss nod at one another. Then, you each take a leg, simultaneously swinging your weapons to shatter the armor and knock the construct to the ground, where the light within dies.

> [[ aetheric revenant was defeated. ]]

“That's what I'm talking about.” You say.

“You're telling me.” She responds. “Time to catch up with the team?”

“Hang on,” You say, as a familiar light catches your attention. You raise an eyebrow; Ael is turning a bit red. “Let's see if we've got anything.”

Celestial Gem x2

There's an awkward pause.

44287581.name: Sylvetica
44287581.comment:
>>44287126

“Not quite. We'll scout him out, go for an ambush.” You suggest.

“Sending forward to Nel now. I hope he's alright.” Aelriss says.

“Let Kainzo know too, just in case.” You look for lightning in the woods, then begin through the brush, planning to circle around the battle. Things have quieted down a bit. “We could use some leadership.”

“Especially when it comes with that magic shield.” She shrugs, and Eunoia lands on her shoulder as she moves past you.

“Yeah, that certainly helps his image. I was surprised when he said he was packing.” You roll your eyes. “Really put his foot down as far as leadership goes, you know?”

“Uh, packing?” She stifles a laugh, giving you an incredulous look. “That's what you call it?”

“You got a better word?” You ask. “I was just trying to say, the Guardians had me under the impression that they funneled all of their Gems Liza's way.”

“What, really? You think anyone would stay in the guild if that was the case?” She scoffs. “I mean, maybe they've got a banking system, but I'm pretty sure they just have more Gems than everyone else. You're still thinking about this? Is now even the time?”

“Not at all.” You say, then continue. “Think Andor's got an Artifact?”

“I wouldn't know.” She responds. “Guy like him doesn't seem like he'd still be alive without one.”

Her UI pings.

“They're taking cover,” Aelriss says. “Hiding. I've got a map. Stay low, stay quiet.”

Like this, you maneuver through the woods, taking a twisted path that shows signs of a supernaturally-charged struggle. Then, you see the faint glint of the Corrupted Artificer's armor in the distance, the violet glow of the ring of flame that hovers idly around his body. He's levitating slowly forward, six feet off the ground, with another aetheric revenant at his side.

You can't pick out any of the other party members through the brush. Aelriss looks at you in anticipation.

> Write-in

Kjorikos unleashes another arcane greatsword, this time extending it into a combination that cleaves the tree Tatsumaki's just leapt from into three parts. He keeps up the swing, floating around his golem to extend it in a wide arc through the trees; Kainzo's Bastion emerges, large, luminescent, but most importantly, in the way, blocking the strike and shattering itself as the blade comes undone.

“Now!” He shouts, and you see his cloak fluttering as he leaps from the brush nearby. The golem moves to intercept, and he parries the massive fist with his greatsword, guiding it to the ground in search of space to engage the Artificer.

There's shouting, as Vyx joins him, cartwheeling into the open and landing on one knee, a surprising number of her blood-red caster bolts managing to find their target. Nel and Andor arrive next, light attackers that he seems more cautious to approach directly, likely due to the surprise bomb earlier.

> [[ PP Regeneration ]]

Your sinuses clear as you consume pickled moonroot. No negative side effects, yet. Seems handy.

Aelriss is getting ready to move. You guess that's as good a signal as any.

44288886.name: Sylvetica
44288886.comment:
>>44288515

Salvage, boys.

You're falling towards Kjorikos at high speed, two-handing a bastard sword shielded by concussive force. If only the ground were breakable—then you'd have a home field advantage. And, hey, who's to say it isn't? You'll work on your swing for next time, or maybe invest in a hammer.

Either way, you love it when a plan comes together. He's tangled up in the combat below, not taking much damage. But he doesn't need to; it was, after all, a distraction. He turns upward to face you, preparing a lightning bolt all too late. Instead, he pulls away, levitating himself not-quite out of reach of your swing. At the touch of your blade, he's buffeted with immense force, and sent all the way to the ground, crashing down on one hand and one knee hard enough to flatten the grass in a six foot radius.

> [[ HP: 29 / 35 ]]
> [[ PP: 4 / 8 ]]

You're caught off-guard by the sparks that rocket along your blade—a reactive attack. You don't let it deter you as your PP begins to regenerate.

> [[ Continued ]]

44288932.name: Sylvetica

>>44288886

“Much appreciated, Ascheritte!” You hear Dorian shout, and his attack, an arc of wind energy you've seen only once before, rockets out of the treeline, colliding with the Artificer's chest and launching him backwards. Then Donnel—who's also been too slow to engage properly—emerges from nearby, taking advantage of the opening with an overhead swing that hits the Artificer square in the face, sending a wave of force reverberating across the ground.

> [[ aetheric revenant was defeated. ]]

“We won't yield so easily, Artificer.” Behind you, Kainzo and Andor draw their blades from the body of the defeated construct. That fast, huh? You shouldn't be surprised.

“At least, I wasn't planning on it.” Andor adds.

“Retreat if you're hurt,” Kainzo shouts. “But don't let small damage turn you away!”

“Careful!” Vyx shouts, diverting her fire from Kjorikos to targets further behind. “There's another one coming.”

You land on your feet, ready to follow up, but take just a moment in observation. Violet sparks are welling up around the downed Artificer, as he struggles to deflect the upcoming blows. The world surrounding him is beginning to warp and distort, twisting like the eye of a storm.

> Try and pin Kjorikos down for the last explosive.
> Defend until the next opening—something's going down, and you don't like it.

44289548.name: Sylvetica
44289548.comment:
>>44288932

“Hold on!” Kainzo shouts. “Get back, now!”

“All that you see here is merely a sorrowful memory!” Clouds sweep in overhead: an aphotic storm forms no more than twenty or thirty feet off the ground, then begins spewing bolts of hideous lightning in all directions. You struggle to maintain your footing as the earth breaks; the raid members flee along separate lanes formed by deep fissures opening in the ground below, leading into darkness.

“So you're just going to destroy it?” Ayla is standing on the edge of a newly-formed stone outcropping, accenting her inquiry with shots from her dual casters. A blast of lightning from above sets the forest alight, raising an enormous wall of flames in the treeline; an explosion blows her platform away, sending her tumbling down onto a tiny ledge overlooking the abyss. 

“Such strong emotions. Are you afraid of loss?” You watch the Artificer make his way to the edge of the fissure, preparing to follow up with a flurry of his own. “Yes, your fate is already sealed.”

The earth below you bucks and roils. Whatever you're standing on isn't going to last, and you stumble toward cover from the raging storm. Ayla's got nowhere to go, and is climbing the rock face, totally exposed. Kjorikos is drawing a circle of violet flames, aimed at her; then, Tatsumaki leaps up from the pit behind him, knocking him across the head with a gauntleted fist.

Energy's welling up again. You have to dodge, and tumble backwards into what's left of the woods as another eldritch bolt obliterates your previous foothold. You start back towards the Artificer, buffeted by harsh winds that threaten to throw you off the edge, looking back up in time to see his fire blast go wide, destroying the shelf under Ayla—leaving her free-climbing. He's got Tatsumaki by the neck, holding her up—as she struggles uselessly—in one hand, and throws her flat against the cliff face on the opposite side of the gap.

> [[ Continued ]]

44289774.name: Sylvetica
44289774.comment:
>>44289548

It's a hell of a jump. You have to do something, but even with a running start, you think, you could only barely make it. As you start to watch her fall, before you can plot a course of action, you see Andor emerge on the opposite side of the gap. He tosses himself onto his stomach, flat against the edge of the fissure, to catch Tatsumaki with one hand. But now, he's starting to slide off, too.

Then, you get the distraction you're looking for. Kainzo and Nel are next to meet the Artificer, and he's a match for both of them, holding them at bay as swords and daggers clash with armored gauntlets. He's ignoring Vyx's shots from the opposite end of the clearing; she's having enough trouble aiming as it is. You look back at the gap, with Andor, Tatsumaki, and Ayla all on the cusp of falling, and wonder how long those two can duel Kjorikos, even injured as he appears.

“Aelriss!” You turn, and shout to her, a different fissure now separating the two of you. “I need you to—!”

She's standing frozen, trembling, cut off from you by a growing wall of raging fire.

Only Eunoia joins you, whistling gravely as it lands on your shoulder.

44289836.name: Sylvetica
44289836.comment:
>>44289774

“Ascheritte...” Just when you think there's enough bullshit going on already, a woman's voice calls out to you from the fissure adjacent... in the opposite direction from the rest of the raid. You glance over, and see a familiar face—but fair-skinned and cream-colored, rather than marbleized as you're familiar with. She is thin, and ghostly, and in royal dress; she hangs, by one arm, from the edge of a small shelf about fifteen feet below you. She is the woman from the empty picture frame.

“...Velika?” You ask. Then, you stagger, catching your breath, when your eye catches the decorative brooch in the center of her chest. It's what you've been looking for, all this time. A Celestial Gem.

“Please,” She says. “Help me. Free us from this curse.”

You hear Nel scream, and your vision snaps back to the battle in time to see him and Kainzo on the defensive, bodies crackling with violet lightning. Aelriss is still standing at the edge of the flames—Tatsumaki, Ayla, and Andor are still situated over the edge of the cliff. The situation does not seem to be improving.

“Ascheritte!” Kainzo shouts, as Kjorikos turns towards you, beginning a slow march; you imagine if he didn't have that cracked mask on, he'd be at least grinning. “What the hell are you doing!?”

You tremble, sword ready.

> Write-in.

>>44290128

> [[ 84 ]]

“Ashe! Help us!” Nel shouts. “Where are you going!?”

The arcane blade cuts a lock of hair from the top of your head as you hit the ground rolling, leaping into the pit. You need more Celestial Gems. The fall isn't terribly long; you slow your descent with one hand and one foot planted against the slanted dirt cliff, coming to a stumbling stop on the edge of the unstable shelf.

“I've got you.” You take the maiden's hand, tossing her onto your back. This is going to be the tricky part; without wasting movement, you turn, feet sliding in the dirt, and leap to grab hand and footholds in the cliff face as the shelf below you collapses.

“Thank you...” She speaks. “I knew this is what you would choose.”

It's a tough climb. The storm rages above, harsh winds reaching even down below. You hear Kjorikos's footsteps.

> [[ Fatigued ]]

You're almost at the top, within arm's reach of the edge, but you're slowing down. The weight of an additional person, even one so light and ghostly, is taking a toll on you.

> [[ PP: 6 / 8 ]]
> [[ Moonroot Poisoning: Dizzy ]]

Your vision shakes.

Damnit. Not now.

> [[ 53 ]]

Lightning's strike throws your hand free of the cliff, showering your face with dirt. There's grit in your eyes and teeth. The second strike sends searing heat up the length of your arm, blood boiling.

> [[ HP: 8 / 35 ]]
> [[ Dazed ]]

Fractal patterns—lichtenberg figures, you think they're called—run the length of your bare, burned arm. You begin to lose your grip, but a chatter in your ear reminds you that Eunoia is on your shoulder. With a faint whistling, the bird of paradise fades away, suffusing your body with withering light.

> [[ HP: 9 / 35 ]]
> [[ Status Effects Negated ]]

> [[ Continued ]]

44291149.name: Sylvetica
44291149.comment:
>>44291106

With a powerful leap, you pull yourself and Velika over the edge, allowing her to slide off your back and settle down behind you. Then, you draw your blade again, staring down the Corrupted Artificer.

“Kjorikos.” You command. “Do you see what you've driven her to?”

He stands, frozen, before pointing his blade in your direction.

You miscalculated. He simply does not care.

No, wait. He's looking through you.

You turn, just a bit, to catch an image of a twisted, marble face—with a mouth of elongated razor teeth, hands twisted into claws, blotches of dark for eye-sockets—closing in on you at incredible speed from behind.

Kjorikos's lance comes within an inch of your shoulder on its way to splitting her head apart. Her body, still carrying momentum, brushes against you, falling limply in the dirt.

As his blade begins to vanish, there's a loud crash as Kainzo's sword ricochets off the back of his armored head, sending him reeling. He stumbles, unable to straighten up before Nel lands on his back, planting daggers between his shoulder blades.

He grabs the Explorer, throwing him into the bushes, then pulls one of the daggers from his back with a grunt, sending it spinning through the air towards you.

> [[ 95 ]]

But you bat the weapon aside with your off-handed buckler, moving forward and taking your blade in both hands—then, with a piercing upward thrust, planting it completely through his chest. It slides between armor plates, and he falls into a kneeling position, hanging limply on the end of your sword.

There's a lull, as the storm settles.

“Mm...” He speaks, taking slow, labored breaths. Black ichor drips from the wound, and pours from the bottom of his mask. “...I was careless.”

> Write-in.

44291825.name: Sylvetica
44291825.comment:
>>44291149

“You weren't the only one.” You respond. Your blade is at a sticking point, and you plant your foot on his shoulder to remove it, in a splash of ichor. “You saved me?”

“I merely seized the initiative.” He speaks. Kainzo and Nel draw closer, cautiously, as the wind slows and the flames die away. “It's more than likely I would have become her next target. Do not mistake my gesture for kindness; are we not enemies, after all?”

“Will she still continue to haunt me? Velika.” You ask, moving past the question.

“Perhaps.” He responds. “Or, perhaps she and I both will fade from memory together.”

“Fine. One more thing.” You say. “The Celestial Gems...”

“I carry a trinket with me.” The Artificer says, slumping slightly. “There is only so much I know. By the time you have returned it to its rightful place in my study, you will know as well.”

“Artificer.” Kainzo says. “Are you also a player?”

“We are all players, in some game.” In all of his weakness, he scoffs. “What are you playing at?”

“Fine.” The Crimson Guardian hisses, unsatisfied with the answer. “Then, tell me: is the past so terrible as you say?”

“No—there is nothing more beautiful, or I would not have created this place.” He says. “Nor would I have tried to restore my love to form. Perhaps all of this would have been different. But all that I have said is true. Loss is reality. It cannot be restored in effigy. Take heed, and ensure that you too... do not succumb.”

With a dull thud, he collapses. Likewise, you hear a distant, contented sigh. Kjorikos and Velika die together. They lie side by side, their ichor mixing in the dirt.

44293013.name: Sylvetica
44293013.comment:
>>44292273

“Just make sure we explore this place thoroughly on the way out.” You suggest, shaking your head. You turn away from the two of them, making your way over to Aelriss. “You alright?”

“Fine.” She says. “I'm fine. My health was low, I panicked, sorry.”

You nod, watching her struggle to her feet. The raid slowly regroups—everyone seems alright, though a bit quiet, rather than overly celebratory right this second—and you make your way down to the study, the group picking apart the surroundings for anything apparently useful on the way.

> [[ Ancient Cathedral: Inner Sanctum – Kjorikos's Study // PVP Disabled ]] 

Back here. Rows of bookshelves form long aisles leading through the place, with a pedestal situated against the far wall: a glass case, that holds a device called an Aetheric Resonator. Against the outer walls, there's multiple laboratory setups larger than the alchemy table at the Writ Keepers' hall. A chandelier hanging high above the middle of the room provides ample light, and you can see large moth-like insects fluttering above.

“Well,” Donnel sighs. “We did it, for whatever it's worth.”

“Woop woop.” Vyx says. “Fuck yeah, we did.”

“Just have to figure out where he keeps the business.” Ayla says. “Should be somewhere in here.”

“Until then, we've little cause to celebrate.” Dorian adds.

“Here,” Kainzo says, at the furthest wall of the room. “Something's missing from this shelf.”

You turn in time to see bookshelves part, as the back wall opens.

> [[ Continued ]]

44293049.name: Sylvetica
44293049.comment:
>>44293013

It looks like a chamber once meant for worship—dismantled by a man who had no faith in the gods his world served. Rustic brick walls, with shelves torn down. Around the outside of the room, tables are stocked with unused machine parts and blueprints.

At the back of the room, you see a Celestial Materialization Altar. It's carved from a single massive slab of white granite. It depicts a man cradling a dying woman in his arms, her head tilted back, empty eyes forever fixated on the heavens. In her lap is a bowl, decorated in gold, awaiting an offering. On the pedestal, you see a simple lockbox.

> [[ A Precursor's Hoard // PVP Enabled ]]

Oh, okay. Sure, whatever.

No one speaks, but a few people exchange nervous glances—an air of “you'd better not try anything funny”. Doesn't seem like a good time to make a joke, so you stay quiet.

Kainzo takes the lead, moving up to investigate the chest; Ayla's going over the selection of machine parts, while Aelriss is outside of the zone eyeing the Resonator. The others are nervously shuffling about on the outskirts of the room.

> Check out the lockbox.
> Check out the altar.
> Check out the parts.
> Write-in.

>>44293049

“Dorian, I'm sending some of these items your way to identify. Can you handle it?” Kainzo asks.

“I'll run out of PP.” Dorian says.

“Oh, suck on a moonroot.” Vyx laughs. “You'll love it, I promise.”

“This is amazing.” Ayla says. “I was mentioning some of these parts to some of the other top Techs, regarding excavation. Some of this stuff is high quality—but more importantly, I think this is the rest of what we need to get the Averron City message boards back up. We could put the server in our guild hall...”

“So you're in control of it?” Donnel raises an eyebrow.

“Hey, chill.” Vyx says. “It's probably safer there than in public. Give it a shot,. The shit already got blown up once.”

You offer the broken UI you've been holding onto to the Altar, watching it break up into brilliant dust and illuminate the room briefly, before actually checking the thing out.

> [[ With the defeat of a Precursor, you are free to spare this domain, or allow it to fade from memory. ]]

> [[ Greater Celestial Materialization Altar ]]
> Celestial Manifestation “The First Artificer's Sanctum”
> MANIFESTATION GRANTED BY:
a Precursor, “and I shall love thee better after death”
> [[ Offer Celestial Gems ]]
* Create Celestial Artifact
* Enhance Celestial Artifact
* Empower Mundane Item
* Enhance Celestial Manifestation
* Destroy Celestial Manifestation (to the victors go the spoils)
> [[ Offer Item ]]
* Offer an Item to the Celestials 

“Guys? It's a Greater.” You suggest. “And it's giving us the choice to burn this whole place down, if I'm not mistaken.”

“This is a Manifestation? And we can destroy it for free?” Andor asks. “I don't get it. Dungeon bosses and everything inside, it's all supposed to respawn.”

“What?” Nel asks. “Then why would we do that?”

“Maybe...” Vyx says. “We don't want people to get what we got, and to know what we know.”

> [[ Continued ]]

44293784.name: Sylvetica
44293784.comment:
>>44293641

“That's not doing it for me.” Donnel says. Andor joins you at the altar, looking it up and down. “We're all supposed to reach the surface together, aren't we? We can't -do- that without building ourselves a civilization.”

“Tell that to Freakshow!” Vyx sticks her tongue out. “If you wanna get shot in the face by a Kjorikos cosplayer, I bet we can make that happen for you right now -without- leaving loot lying around for anyone.”

“Psh.” Dorian scoffs, quietly identifying items in the corner. “As if Freakshow's ranks contain members so elite as us. You believe they could clear this dungeon?”

Personally, you'd like to see him take a turn in the ring with Anaximander.

“I see it as the opportunity to build something better.” Kainzo's struggling a bit to get the box open. “We'll need something bigger and safer than any of the guild halls eventually. Even the facilities the Artificer had here could be useful, if this place were emptied of threats.”

You look over at Kainzo, who stifles a laugh as the lid pops off the lockbox.

“Okay, uh. What the actual fuck?” He says. “Yeah, uh. This was probably worth us getting killed for.”

“Yeah, I think I'm already dead.” Vyx is standing slack-jawed at his side.

> [[ Inventory: precursor's hoard ]]
assorted jewels (10401 credits total)
Celestial Gem x24

“I'm not even looking.” Ayla says, from across the room. “How many?”

“Twenty-four by my count.” Kainzo says.

“Two-across to each man leaves one for each of our organizations.” Ayla nods. “Don't dwell on it. Sound fair to you, Kainzo?”

The Crimson Guardian glares at you.

“Yeah,” He says. “Sure.”

> Confront. “Is there something you'd like to say?”
> Change topic. “Who gets the Resonator?”
> Ignore. Suggest you start dividing the loot, round-robin.
> Curiosity. Make a suggestion as to the fate of the Sanctum. (Write-in.)

You believe that statement merely means that it's currently free. You've seen the same option at Averron City's altar. Hopefully you'd have to pay to do it, or fulfill some other qualifier such as being a specific person; otherwise, any random person could blow up Averron City at will.

>>44293789
>>44293782
A Greater Materialization Altar can only project a single Manifestation. Enhancing it applies upgrades or new facilities to the existing one; a new Manifestation can't be created so long as one already exists.

“Hold on,” You suggest. “This place has potential. You and Ayla both agree that we're going to need some sort of research bureau.”

“It'd be neutral ground.” Ayla says. “And maybe his Observatory is up there, still. We could experiment with what the outside was like.”

“The message board server could be placed here, and the Resonator free for anyone who wanted to use it.” Kainzo says. “The same fate would befall Kjorikos's alchemy labs. I'm growing more fond of the idea by the second.”

He kneels before the Altar.

“If you've been listening,” He speaks, gazing up at the statue. “I'd like to secure this place as neutral territory in the name of the Alliance and all those who dwell in Averron. We desire a safe haven to research the mysteries of this world, and plan our journey to the lands beyond.”

“That was good,” Ayla says.

There's a pause, then a faint rumbling, as the eyes of the man and woman begin to glow.

> [[ Your cause is noble. ]]
> [[ The First Artificer was unfaithful to us, and to the memory of the one he loved most. ]]
> [[ However, his knowledge can serve you still. ]]
> [[ Return to us ten of our gifts, and we will grant your desire. ]]

“That's generous.” Kainzo says. “If we want it, that leaves fourteen Gems in the stash for a total of fifteen from the raid.”

“Which would be one for everyone, and one to each group, with one left over.” Ayla says. “Throw it on the pile?”

“If we're distributing round-robin, it's an obvious first-pick. That seems like a problem.” Donnel says. “Just being reasonable.”

“I don't see anything wrong with it.” Aelriss shrugs.

> Divvy the loot with the extra Gem on top.
> Write-in.

“Ten gives us a lot.” You say. “We could consider an upgrade with what we've got here.”

“You're asking what we could get for all the Gems?” Kainzo asks, still on one knee.

“The answer is a riot.” Vyx says, then shrugs off the glares she gets. “What? I don't mean to be insubordinate, Kainzo, but I think everyone wants a share. We're founding this place, aren't we?”

“The lady has a point.” Dorian says.

“Offer the extra Gem, too, then.” Ayla says. “Maybe we'll get a bonus.”

“Celestials could restock the fridge.” Donnel says.

"Alright, we'll do that last." Kainzo says, slowly moving Gems from the chest to the Altar. "Eleven in the pot."

“By the way, I'm done.” Dorian says. “I'm sending some information now.”

> * Intimidation [[ Granted by: wrought iron deathmask ]]: Unknown effect.
> * Red Carpet [[ Granted by: jeweled sandals ]]: Unknown effect.
> * Nullify [[ Granted by: aetherbinder's cloak ]]: Reduces incoming elemental damage.
> * Charisma [[ Granted by: godhead's brooch, decorated stola ]]: Sometimes reduce item prices. Allow unique interactions with some NPCs.
> * Aethersteel Armor: Unknown effect.
> * Aethersteel Weapon: Attacks with aethersteel weapons will deal bonus non-elemental magic damage.
> * Aethersteel Constructions: Aethersteel builds are highly resistant to heat and pressure.

“Cool stuff.”

"You couldn't identify all of them?"

"It's not letting me. Perhaps my skill isn't high enough?"

“Is anyone looking at that last one?”

> * Rememory [[ Granted by: traitorous kris ]]: Attacks with this weapon will inflict grievous wounds against members of the wielder's party and guild.

“...”

“I'm shooting whoever picks that one. Instantly. On principle.”

“I'm first-picking it to defend myself from her.”

“Are we doing this, then? I'm rolling it now... Ashe, you've got first-pick.”

“Fine by me.”

> [[ Continued ]]
